circumstances:
On final approach to San Francisco Airport, the aircraft lost 400 feet in few seconds then nosed down and eventually crashed into the bay of San Francisco, some two miles short of runway. All 11 occupants were killed.
Crew:
A. R. Thompson, pilot,
Joe De Cesaro, copilot,
Ruth Kimmel, stewardess. 
Passengers:
John A. Orennan Sr.,
Gertrude Orennan, 
Mark Fontana, 
J. Franklin Gilmore, 
Frank Margaroni,
Raker Meyers,
H. D. Friedlander,
Myron Loite.
probable_cause: It is the opinion of the Accident Board that the probable cause of this accident was accidental jamming of the elevator controls as the result of a microphone being inadvertently dropped and lodging in such a position that the crew was unable to prevent rapid descent of the airplane.
